profile_data.summary:
I am a Data Engineer with over 3 years of experience in building scalable ETL pipelines, real-time data processing, and cloud-based data architectures. Skilled in SQL, Python, Apache Airflow, Kafka, and dbt, I specialize in designing efficient, automated, and high-performance data solutions across AWS, GCP, and Azure.

My expertise lies in developing and optimizing ETL workflows, reducing processing time and query execution by over 30%, and building data lake and warehouse solutions using Redshift, Snowflake, and BigQuery. I have also engineered real-time streaming pipelines to enhance low-latency processing and decision-making.

Beyond data engineering, I focus on workflow automation, data integrity, and performance monitoring. I build CI/CD pipelines with Terraform & Jenkins, develop Power BI and AWS CloudWatch dashboards, and implement data quality checks to ensure reliable insights.

projects.description:
The Enhanced Course Enrollment and Notification System is a project developed as part of the Structured Systems and Analysis course at the University of Maryland Baltimore County (UMBC). This system aims to improve the course registration process by automating waitlist management, facilitating cross-departmental enrollment, and providing real-time notifications to students. By enhancing transparency and user experience for both students and administrative staff, the system addresses inefficiencies and streamlines communication.

Key features include a centralized dashboard for tracking enrollments and waitlist positions, customizable notification preferences via SMS or email, and a feedback mechanism for continuous improvement. This project represents a modernized approach to course registration, aligning with UMBC's commitment to academic excellence and innovation through technology.
projects.title: Enhanced Course Enrollment and Notification System

projects.description:
Designed and implemented a robust Oracle-based database system for an e-commerce platform, streamlining operations and supporting scalability. This project automated critical processes such as customer management, order processing, inventory updates, and reporting, delivering an efficient and maintainable system.

Key Highlights:

Developed and optimized PL/SQL stored procedures for core operations, reducing manual intervention by 30%.
Built modular and reusable helper functions, enhancing code maintainability and operational efficiency.
Designed automated Oracle sequences for seamless ID generation across database entities, supporting over 1,000 records.
Implemented exception handling to ensure robust error detection and minimized runtime issues.
Collaborated closely with the team to unify components into a scalable schema and documented scripts for seamless maintenance.
projects.title: Online Shopping Database System

Supply Chain & Data Analyst | Optimizing Processes with Analytics & Automation

projects.description:
This project focused on enhancing cybersecurity defenses against ransomware attacks using machine learning techniques. By analyzing a dataset of 62,485 instances, various machine learning models, including Random Forest, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, and Gradient Boosting, were implemented to detect malicious files. The project achieved an accuracy of up to 97.25% and an AUC of 0.9724.

Extensive data preprocessing and feature engineering were performed to optimize the dataset, including handling outliers, standardizing numerical features, and encoding categorical variables. Exploratory data analysis (EDA) and visualizations such as scatter plots and ROC curves guided model development and performance evaluation.

Additionally, recovery planning strategies were proposed to minimize the impact of ransomware attacks, emphasizing operational resilience and reducing system downtime. This project highlighted the potential of machine learning to enhance predictive capabilities in cybersecurity frameworks.
projects.title: Ransomeware Detection and Recovery Planning
